meta.description: Trait cards for Damn Nature You Scary evolution game
meta.grants_format: TILES: what tiles you can occupy | COMPETITION: bonuses vs other traits | ALLELES: income effects | SURVIVAL: extinction bonuses
meta.balance_notes: PLAYTESTING: Cost should scale with era_min and complexity. Suggested formula: ceil(era_min/3 + complexity/2 + power_modifier). Adjust based on play experience.

traits.name: Bilateral Symmetry
traits.grants: FOUNDATION: Required for most traits. Enables directed movement.
traits.science: Bilateral symmetry emerged ~555 MYA, enabling directed movement and cephalization

traits.name: Segmentation
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: Lose 1 fewer marker during extinctions (redundancy).
traits.science: Segmentation allows specialization of body regions (tagmosis) and evolutionary flexibility

traits.name: Exoskeleton
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 vs non-armored on any tile. SURVIVAL: Protected from predation.
traits.science: Chitin exoskeletons provide protection but require molting for growth

traits.name: Compound Eyes
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 on tiles with predators (detect threats).
traits.science: Compound eyes have thousands of ommatidia, excellent for detecting movement

traits.name: Trilobite Eyes
traits.grants: TILES: +1 on Shallow Marine. COMPETITION: +2 vs blind organisms.
traits.science: Trilobite eyes were made of calcite crystal - the only known mineral-based lenses in nature

traits.name: Protective Shell
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 vs predators. Cannot be displaced by organisms without [Predator].
traits.science: Calcium carbonate shells first appeared in the Cambrian, driving the 'arms race' of evolution

traits.name: Gills
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy Ocean, Shallow Sea, Reef, Freshwater. Required for aquatic life.
traits.science: Gills extract dissolved O2 via countercurrent exchange, ~80% efficient

traits.name: Notochord
traits.grants: FOUNDATION: Unlocks vertebrate traits. -1 cost if have Gills.
traits.science: The notochord is a flexible rod providing skeletal support, precursor to the spine

traits.name: Vertebral Column
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 vs invertebrates. Enables larger body sizes.
traits.science: Vertebrae replaced the notochord, enabling larger body sizes and complex movement

traits.name: Jaws
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs [Aquatic] prey. Can displace [Shelled] organisms.
traits.science: Jaws evolved from gill arches ~430 MYA, revolutionizing feeding strategies

traits.name: Cartilaginous Skeleton
traits.grants: TILES: +1 on Ocean, Deep Sea. COMPETITION: +1 vs bony fish (buoyancy).
traits.science: Sharks and rays have cartilage skeletons - lighter than bone, requires less energy

traits.name: Bony Skeleton
traits.grants: FOUNDATION: Required for tetrapod evolution. COMPETITION: +1 from muscle attachment.
traits.science: Bone stores calcium and phosphorus, enables stronger muscle attachments

traits.name: Swim Bladder
traits.grants: TILES: +1 on all aquatic tiles (energy-efficient swimming). Precursor to lungs.
traits.science: Swim bladder regulates buoyancy by adjusting gas volume - precursor to lungs

traits.name: Lobed Fins
traits.grants: TILES: Can prop up in shallow water. FOUNDATION: Required for limbs.
traits.science: Lobed fins contain bones homologous to tetrapod limbs - humerus, radius, ulna

traits.name: Lungs
traits.grants: TILES: Survive in low-O2 water, Coast, Swamp. FOUNDATION: Required for land life.
traits.science: Lungs evolved from swim bladders, enabling exploitation of atmospheric O2

traits.name: Tetrapod Limbs
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy all land tiles (Forest, Grassland, Desert, Mountain). Walk between tiles.
traits.science: First tetrapods like Tiktaalik (~375 MYA) bridged fish and amphibian body plans

traits.name: Moist Permeable Skin
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Swamp, Freshwater. Must stay near water. Breathe through skin.
traits.science: Amphibian skin supplements lung breathing but requires constant moisture

traits.name: Aquatic Eggs
traits.grants: ALLELES: +2/era. TILES: Must reproduce on aquatic tiles or Swamp.
traits.science: External fertilization in water - high fecundity but vulnerable eggs

traits.name: Broadcast Spawning
traits.grants: ALLELES: +3/era (massive offspring). RISK: Extremely vulnerable to marine extinctions.
traits.science: Release millions of gametes into water - low survival but huge numbers

traits.name: Amniotic Egg
traits.grants: TILES: Reproduce on any land tile (no water needed). FOUNDATION: Unlocks reptile/mammal paths.
traits.science: Amniotic membrane provides private pond for embryo - key terrestrial adaptation

traits.name: Reptilian Scales
traits.grants: TILES: +1 on Desert (water retention). COMPETITION: +1 vs unarmored terrestrial.
traits.science: Keratinized scales prevent water loss - crucial for arid environments

traits.name: Ectothermy
traits.grants: ALLELES: +1/era (low food needs). RISK: DOOMED during ice ages.
traits.science: Body temperature depends on environment - efficient but limits activity in cold

traits.name: Endothermy
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy Ice, Mountain. SURVIVAL: SAFE during ice ages. ALLELES: -1/era (high food).
traits.science: Internal heat production requires 10x more food but enables constant activity

traits.name: Fur
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Ice, Mountain. Reduces heat loss.
traits.science: Hair/fur traps air for insulation - evolved from sensory structures

traits.name: Mammary Glands
traits.grants: ALLELES: -1/era. SURVIVAL: Offspring survive parent death. Optimal nutrition.
traits.science: Mammary glands evolved from modified sweat glands - optimal infant nutrition

traits.name: Live Birth (Viviparity)
traits.grants: MARKERS: +1 marker each era (protected offspring). Fewer but guaranteed survivors.
traits.science: Internal development protects embryo but limits offspring number

traits.name: Placenta
traits.grants: MARKERS: Offspring start with +1 tag from parent. Extended development.
traits.science: Placenta enables extended nutrient transfer - offspring born more developed

traits.name: Synapsid Skull
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 from jaw strength. FOUNDATION: Mammal path.
traits.science: Single temporal fenestra allows for larger jaw muscles - ancestor of mammals

traits.name: Diapsid Skull
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 from speed (lighter skull). FOUNDATION: Reptile/Bird path.
traits.science: Two temporal fenestrae reduce skull weight - ancestor of reptiles, birds

traits.name: Upright Posture
traits.grants: TILES: Move 2 tiles per turn. COMPETITION: +1 from efficient locomotion. FOUNDATION: Bird/Croc paths.
traits.science: Legs under body rather than sprawled - enables sustained running

traits.name: Osteoderms
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs predators (bony armor). SURVIVAL: Reduce marker loss by 1. Thermoregulation.
traits.science: Bony plates embedded in skin - secondary armor evolved multiple times in archosaurs

traits.name: Hollow Bones
traits.grants: FOUNDATION: Required for powered flight. Weight reduction.
traits.science: Pneumatic bones reduce weight while maintaining strength - essential for flight

traits.name: Feathers
traits.grants: TILES: +1 on Mountain, Ice. Display for mating. Reduces flight cost.
traits.science: Feathers evolved for insulation/display before being co-opted for flight

traits.name: Powered Flight
traits.grants: TILES: Move to ANY tile (ignore adjacency). Escape predators. COMPETITION: +2 vs flightless.
traits.science: Lift = 0.5 × ρ × v² × A × Cl. Requires ~10% body mass in flight muscles

traits.name: Insect Flight
traits.grants: TILES: Move to ANY tile (first flying animals). COMPETITION: +1 vs crawling insects.
traits.science: Insect wings evolved independently - possibly from gill-like structures

traits.name: Burrowing
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during most extinctions. TILES: +1 on Desert (temperature stability).
traits.science: Burrows provide thermal buffering and protection from surface catastrophes

traits.name: Nocturnal Adaptation
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during K-Pg. COMPETITION: Avoid dinosaur competition (Era 6-8).
traits.science: Nocturnal lifestyle may have allowed early mammals to avoid dinosaur predation

traits.name: Small Size
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during most extinctions. ALLELES: +1/era (less food needed).
traits.science: Small organisms need less resources and have faster generation times

traits.name: Large Size
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 on any tile. RISK: DOOMED during extinctions. ALLELES: -1/era.
traits.science: Cope's Law: lineages tend toward larger size over time, but large size is risky

traits.name: Reef Dwelling
traits.grants: TILES: +3 on Reef tiles. ALLELES: +1/era from controlled Reef. RISK: DOOMED if reefs collapse.
traits.science: Coral reefs are the 'rainforests of the sea' - extreme biodiversity, extreme fragility

traits.name: Deep Sea Adaptation
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during surface extinctions. TILES: Exclusive access to Deep Sea tiles.
traits.science: Deep sea is buffered from surface changes - P = ρgh (pressure increases with depth)

traits.name: Freshwater Adaptation
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during marine extinctions. TILES: +2 on Freshwater, Swamp.
traits.science: Freshwater systems often survive marine extinction events better

traits.name: Six Legs
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy all land tiles. Stable tripod gait. FOUNDATION: Insect traits.
traits.science: Six legs provide stable tripod gait - three legs always on ground

traits.name: Complete Metamorphosis
traits.grants: ALLELES: +2/era (larvae and adults use different niches). Niche separation.
traits.science: Complete metamorphosis separates larval feeding from adult reproduction

traits.name: Eusociality
traits.grants: ALLELES: +2/era if population 5+. TILES: +2 on Forest with flowers (Era 8+).
traits.science: Reproductive division of labor - workers forgo reproduction to help queen

traits.name: Pollination Behavior
traits.grants: TILES: +3 on Forest with flowers (Era 8+). ALLELES: +1/era mutualism bonus.
traits.science: Coevolution with angiosperms - flowers provide nectar, insects provide pollen transfer

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +3 at night (complete darkness hunting). TILES: +2 in caves.
traits.science: Range = (Emitted_Power / Detection_Threshold)^0.25 - up to 100m in some species

traits.name: Crocodilian Body Plan
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy BOTH land AND aquatic (unique). COMPETITION: +3 ambush on Swamp/Coast. SURVIVAL: SAFE all extinctions except ice.
traits.science: Crocodilians are 'living fossils' - body plan unchanged for 200+ million years

traits.name: Death Roll
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +3 vs [Large] prey. Can displace any organism on Swamp/Freshwater tiles.
traits.science: Crocodilians spin rapidly to dismember large prey - unique hunting technique requiring powerful jaw muscles

traits.name: Venom
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs any organism. Can displace larger organisms.
traits.science: Venom evolved independently 100+ times - scorpions had venom by the Silurian (~430 MYA)

traits.name: Arboreal Lifestyle
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Forest. Escape ground predators. FOUNDATION: Primate path.
traits.science: Tree-dwelling requires grasping limbs and enhanced spatial awareness

traits.name: Opposable Digits
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 (tool use potential). TILES: +1 on Forest. Precision grip.
traits.science: Opposable thumbs enable precision grip - key to primate success

traits.name: Encephalization
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +3 (problem solving). ALLELES: -2/era (brain energy cost).
traits.science: Brain tissue uses 20x more energy than muscle - expensive but powerful

traits.name: R-Strategy Reproduction
traits.grants: ALLELES: +2/era. MARKERS: +2 each era. RISK: Lose more in extinctions (boom-bust).
traits.science: Many offspring, little parental care - thrives in unstable environments

traits.name: K-Strategy Reproduction
traits.grants: ALLELES: -1/era. SURVIVAL: Markers cannot be displaced. Stable population.
traits.science: Few offspring, high parental investment - thrives in stable environments

traits.name: Parental Care
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: Markers protected from displacement. ALLELES: -1/era (investment cost).
traits.science: Parental care increases offspring survival at cost of parent resources

traits.name: Tropical Specialist
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Reef, Rainforest, Swamp. RISK: DOOMED in Ice Ages.
traits.science: Tropical specialists thrive in warm, stable climates but are vulnerable to cooling

traits.name: Shallow Marine Specialist
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Shallow Sea, Coast. RISK: DOOMED during sea level changes.
traits.science: Continental shelf habitats are productive but vulnerable to sea level fluctuations

traits.name: Pelagic Lifestyle
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Ocean. SURVIVAL: SAFE during reef collapses. Open water specialist.
traits.science: Pelagic organisms live in open water, independent of the seafloor or coast

traits.name: Filter Feeding
traits.grants: TILES: Cannot move. ALLELES: +2/era (passive feeding). RISK: DOOMED if sea level drops.
traits.science: Filter feeders strain food particles from water - efficient but immobile

traits.name: Photosynthetic Symbiosis
traits.grants: TILES: +3 on Reef (zooxanthellae). ALLELES: +1/era. RISK: DOOMED if light blocked.
traits.science: Coral and giant clams host photosynthetic algae - mutualistic symbiosis

traits.name: Detritivore
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during volcanic winters (eat decay). TILES: +1 on Swamp, Forest floor.
traits.science: Detritivores recycle dead organic matter - essential ecosystem role

traits.name: Ecological Specialist
traits.grants: DYNAMIC: Specialize in a random occupied biome. Gain one of its bonus tags permanently. COMPETITION: +3 on that biome type. RISK: DOOMED during global warming.
traits.science: Specialists outcompete generalists in stable environments but are vulnerable to change

traits.name: Flippers
traits.grants: TILES: Occupy Ocean, Coast, Shallow Sea. COMPETITION: +2 in aquatic tiles. Cannot walk on land.
traits.science: Limbs modified into flippers evolved convergently in whales, seals, and marine reptiles

traits.name: Blubber
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Ocean, Ice (thermal insulation). Buoyancy aid and energy reserve.
traits.science: Blubber provides insulation, buoyancy, and energy storage - up to 50% of body mass in some whales

traits.name: Breath Hold Mastery
traits.grants: TILES: Access Deep Sea without gills. Spleen blood storage enables 2+ hour dives.
traits.science: Marine mammals evolved enlarged spleens and myoglobin stores for extended dives to 3000m

traits.name: Tentacles
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 (grasping prey). Eight+ prehensile limbs with suckers.
traits.science: Cephalopod arms contain 2/3 of their neurons - each arm can act semi-independently

traits.name: Jet Propulsion
traits.grants: TILES: Move 2 aquatic tiles per turn. Rapid escape from predators.
traits.science: Cephalopods expel water through a siphon for thrust - fastest invertebrate locomotion

traits.name: Ink Sac
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: Avoid 1 predation per era. Melanin cloud confuses predators.
traits.science: Cephalopod ink contains melanin and tyrosinase - can numb predator senses

traits.name: Chromatophores
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs predators (camouflage). +1 ambush bonus vs prey.
traits.science: Chromatophores change color in milliseconds via neural control - fastest color change in nature

traits.name: Cephalopod Intelligence
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 (problem solving). Tool use without hands. Short lifespan limits learning.
traits.science: Octopuses solve mazes, use tools, and recognize individuals - the only invertebrate intelligence

traits.name: Defensive Spines
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs predators. Cannot be displaced without [Armored] tag.
traits.science: Spines evolved independently in urchins, fish, reptiles, and mammals - universal defense

traits.name: Camouflage
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +1 on all tiles. Avoid 1 competition roll per era.
traits.science: Cryptic coloration matches environment - background matching, disruptive patterns, countershading

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +2 vs predators (Batesian mimicry). Deceive threats by resembling dangerous species.
traits.science: Batesian mimicry: harmless species evolve to resemble dangerous ones - evolutionary deception

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: Restore 1 lost marker per era. Regrow lost body parts.
traits.science: Starfish regenerate whole arms; salamanders regrow limbs - dedifferentiation of cells

traits.name: Autotomy
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: Escape predation once per era (shed tail/limb). Distract and flee.
traits.science: Voluntary limb loss at fracture planes - lizards, crabs, starfish all use this strategy

traits.name: Hibernation
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: SAFE during ice ages and volcanic winters. Skip harsh eras metabolically.
traits.science: Hibernators drop body temp to near-freezing, heart rate to 5 bpm - extreme energy conservation

traits.name: Venom Immunity
traits.grants: COMPETITION: Ignore [Venom] bonus from opponents. Can prey on venomous species.
traits.science: Honey badgers, mongooses, and opossums evolved modified nicotinic receptors blocking venom

traits.name: Chemosynthesis Symbiosis
traits.grants: TILES: +3 on Hydrothermal Vent tiles. SURVIVAL: SAFE during surface extinctions.
traits.science: Giant tube worms host bacteria that oxidize H2S - independent of solar energy

traits.name: Antifreeze Proteins
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Ice, Deep Sea. Survive subzero temperatures without freezing.
traits.science: Antifreeze glycoproteins bind to ice crystals, preventing growth - found in Arctic fish and insects

traits.name: Pack Hunting
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +3 if 3+ markers on same tile. Coordinate attacks on larger prey.
traits.science: Wolves, hyenas, and orcas coordinate hunts via vocalization - social carnivory

traits.name: Migration
traits.grants: TILES: Move to ANY tile once per era (seasonal movement). Follow resources.
traits.science: Arctic terns migrate 70,000 km/year; wildebeest trek 1,000 km - hardwired navigation

traits.name: Herding Behavior
traits.grants: SURVIVAL: +1 marker protection per adjacent ally marker. Safety in numbers.
traits.science: Herd dilution effect: probability of predation decreases with group size

traits.name: Grinding Teeth
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Grassland, Forest. Process tough plant material efficiently.
traits.science: Hypsodont teeth with flat occlusal surfaces evolved for grinding fibrous plants

traits.name: Ruminant Digestion
traits.grants: ALLELES: +2/era (extract more energy from plants). Multi-chambered stomach fermentation.
traits.science: Four-chambered stomach with microbial symbionts breaks down cellulose humans cannot digest

traits.name: Long Neck
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Forest (reach canopy foliage). Access resources others cannot reach.
traits.science: Sauropods had necks up to 15m long; giraffes have same 7 vertebrae as humans, just longer

traits.name: Electric Organs
traits.grants: COMPETITION: +3 vs aquatic prey. Stun prey and detect via bioelectricity.
traits.science: Electric eels generate 860V; electroreceptors detect prey heartbeats - evolved 6+ times

traits.name: Bioluminescence
traits.grants: TILES: +2 on Deep Sea. Lure prey, communicate, or counter-illuminate for camouflage.
traits.science: Luciferin-luciferase reaction produces cold light - evolved 50+ times independently
